It reminds us of what happened to us, when they locked us away and decided we were no longer human. A testament to why the Ministry should die.
Wake

We’ve locked down certain areas of space, peon. We think the Ministry operate in a few of them and want you to seek out any ships which try to escape. You must eliminate each and every one and bring back a sample of each and every victory. Isolate them, toy with them but make sure their life ends.
Lockdown

Now, peon. It is time to seek out your closest allies, as none should escape the chance for education. The only way you can free the human spirit is to show them it can be freed. The UEF are certainly run in a more egalitarian way but it is essential they know that a new world is now at hand and fully take the chance to embrace it.
Friends

Now, that each of those has been chosen and all have adapted their ways, it is time for us to learn who we are once again. To set up a channel where we can broadcast a fresh signal to all. A clarion call that will not only teach the lessons of now, but one that will form as instruction on the mistakes of the past. Go to work.
Forgotten Learnings

That took some time, my friend. You’ve certainly been busy but the new network you’ve set up for the Black Light allowed me to piggy-back on their signal and get back in contact. I’ve relocated to the Rim again. It seemed the safest place as all that remains here are memories. Whatever the Black Light preach, the reality is different.
Murmur

There seems to be a disconnect within the Black Light itself. Even though they are linked together, they appear to disagree on many things and yet remember them all. Almost a if they suffer from multiple personalities who each make their own decision and then are judged by the rest. It gives me an idea how we can oust them, but I need you to speak to Amita first.
Indirect Discretion

Commander Mishra will still trust you, but bluntly strolling into their space without making a mark, will raise the Black Light suspicions. I’ve attached a probe to your ship which will silently send a message when you are in the heat of combat. Try to make sure you leave the UEF pilots alive and don’t completely finish them off.
Finishing Move

Falcon, it was good to hear your voice and I believe that Nyx is a true ally as we go forward. We won’t receive any time from the companies now they have Black Light puppets at their head. This being said, these puppets are working in one direction and make it easier to judge the enemy actions. Let’s make some noise.
Rattle the Cage

Right Falcon, time is of the essence. We need to prove to the fleet and our allies that we can get a message through to them safely, without drawing any attention. It seems the best way to do this is to employ the technology Nyx uses to communicate with you. This means you need to drop into numerous locations where the supplies will be dropped off and our friends can access them.
Troubled Time

This is Amita Mishra of The Resistance. This transmission is secure, and the Black Light cannot hear us. We will broadcast on this channel at the same time stamp on a high data burst. The information provided will suggest targets to disrupt the Black Light. To ensure security my flagship will relocate before every broadcast and one of our falcons will run interference.
Parry

The drawing of sides is something you humans are most adept at. Where the Sibelon Accord have no hope to follow the various groups which have formed. With old and new merged as one, we do know that we can trust Nyx, Amita and you. We can help further, but we need something in return, if you can spare the time.
Sides

Whilst your allies draw a pretty picture the Sibelon Emperor sees an opportunity to try and take control of regions of Earth space. A stupid fickle plan, which will only end in the death of many of my species. Please stop the emperor dead, and we mean dead, and the Accord will make certain that a message to not attack the Black Light just now, is issued.
Pretty Picture

We have not called on you recently, peon, but we recently received unusual readings from the Sibelon, and seem to have identified a new form of that species out there. We want you to investigate first, then we will decide on how to act. After that we will make you aware of Ministry strongholds to remove.
Underworked

They want evidence, then let’s give them it. We have automatically programmed two of our ships to be in this location, leaving enough DNA residue to confirm they were crewed. The evidence will show truth, as you humans say. ‘Hide a lie in it’, but this should not only distract them from us but see them seek other avenues.
Neat and Tidy

There once was a thing called the Warbond. Each company had it to be able to monitor the pilots who worked for them, identify their loyalty and make decisions on their future. You have one, but it appears to have been broken a number of times, which makes you unusual. We seek to understand more about it. As we have ideas what it may be!
Tracing the Warbond

As expected the Warbond leads directly to the Ministry and we can see their grubby marks all over the integral workings of it. We need you to take out one from each company who has it and then, if our data is correct, we should be able to hunt and capture a Ministry commander. With one in our grasp, we can find more.
A Path to Righteousness

Yes. With that one captive we now can plunder his mind and find more. Each one will reveal others and we can hunt them together, peon. Chase them from their towers and rip them down from under them. They simply will not escape, how ever desperately they try and everyone who is tainted with this brush shall be removed. Everyone!
The Tower Topples

They’re on the run. We have them now and can kill each and every one, peon. The fact they thought they were safe is nothing compared to the pain we feel and the torture we endured. Remember we know it all, the nightmares that they inflicted upon us are fresh in all our memories. They deserve to feel the same pain we do every day.
Every One

With each one that falls another is identified. We will start by climbing the ladder to the very top. If we find them then they shall pay for their ancestors’ evil. Each one shall be held accountable under the eyes of the Black Light. Our nightmares will be there’s and they will be kept in a living hell for all eternity. We have said and so it will be!
Climb the Ladder

Falcon. We’ve made a calculation of the methods the Black Light are going to employ. They’re on a holy war and they won’t stop until each and every one of humanity is dead. The brush taints us far further than you can possibly imagine. We’re simply not ready to face such wrath and we now need to stand together or be a note in history!
Noose

We’ve intercepted a human message which Nyx has managed to decode. She immediately decided to act upon it, while we were sent to contact you. It seems to be a kill list from the Black Light, but it’s the intention behind it. Each target’s family documented to see if the links to the Ministry are apparent in the past. We need to stop them.
Closing Order

We’ve done the math, and even in the best scenarios over 78% of the human race is a target. They’re going to clean out you all as they follow this crazy path to destruction. Humanity will become a mark on the page of time unless we find a way to act, and finally we may be seeing some traction here. We have a plan.
Cleansing

We know the Black Light ships are weaker when they first jump in, understand that they share all thoughts, but sometimes disagree on some fundamental topics. Understand that they plan based on outcome rather than instance and know we can bypass their communications systems and monitoring. Which means we need to learn two more things.
Under Scrutiny

We need to be able to ensure that if any of us are captured, the massive psionic potential of the Black Light cannot rip the knowledge from our mind. Otherwise we’re all compromised. We’ve been lucky until now but it’s time to order a withdrawal of all our agents out in the field until we can build this device.
No Mind

We’ve identified the elements we need, to create devices which will shroud our thoughts from the Black Light’s prying minds. Now we need to collect the relevant elements and of course, one of the sources will be the Kristallon. I know you were contacted by them before and they are unlikely to be helpful, but we need pure and not tainted DNA. Guess what your job is!
Peace Talk

We never thought you would disturb us in this way again, tiny thing. We expected tribute and honor, not demands. You seem to think we are a species that can define fate, and yet you speak with a questionable tone. You can either ask for the sample kindly or we will retaliate. We have needs too and this meeting can be mutual.
Tiny Things Make Problems

The Kristallon were blessed by the star. We are higher than you and you are simply now an irritant, like one of your now lethal colds. Perhaps you should learn to respect your elders and not suggest you will simply take what you need from our corpse if we so not cooperate. Our status is greater than yours and our needs equivalent.
Star Made

It is clear you believe that we are dead, when we are clearly alive. Perhaps you should reassess your understanding before things fail dramatically. Remember that the Kristallon have been mortally wounded by the actions of others and we may seek a time to reflect too. We will provide you with what you need. Just one last thing.
When Called

There’s a time to act, and a time to watch. Though others will say we have meddled, including your Sibelon friends. Understand we only tried to help. Yet, on reflection we can see that we should have followed the path of our brethren. Kill or be killed, belief is key. Others are the enemy. Perhaps it is too late, but we will meet one last time, at the reckoning.
Fire Inside

Now you have the elements we need, it’s time to build and test the device. We have worked out a way to replicate the Kristallon DNA, now we have a sample, but I have a feeling that these early devices won’t last for long. As we develop the technology it will improve. This means we need a field test and We knew you’d want to test it out.
Shrouded Intentions

The device you created with the Sibelon is exceptional, falcon. We are slowly disseminating the information throughout the fleet and soon all our capital ships will have the ability to process the devices. This means our pilots can enter battle on a better footing. You mentioned another potential bonus, so help our new friend by battling the imperial Sibelon.
The Work of the Gods

My thanks for your aid in our cause. With all that is wrong with humanity, I find your ability to pause and consider our needs a good bridge to future negotiations. This leads me to identify the other way you can take advantage of the Black Light. In order to lay this plan in order I need you to strike at these two targets, and then I’ll explain what is next.
Planned Action

Because the Black Light have a self-destruct code in all their equipment we need to steal a weapon which is in development. This involves sneaking into the heart of their space and targeting one type of ship we have identified. They will change their processes after this operation, so make sure you strike the target and get out of there intact.
All in the Timing

We have to admit that we are feeling foolish, human. We suddenly realize that the reason the Black Light are so integrated with their technology is that it is completely organic. Everything, the ships, weapons and shields are created in deep space but are sentient in their own rights. We can certainly adapt this technology, but we need time.
Wake from Slumber

*** Broadcast Incoming *** Black Light! Did you think we would simply rest? Consider us dead and unable to act? We know how to hide from you, defend ourselves and stand together. Do you? Will you attack the people in order to target us? Or does this not make you as bad as the enemy who created you. We await your response!
Belligerent Broadcast

*** Broadcast Incoming *** Has the cat got your tongue? Since you haven’t objected to our broadcast we’ll be back the same time, same channel, next week. Quell that channel and we’ll find another. Hell, we’ll even pass the message by word of mouth if we have to. Remember, freedom of speech is a personal right! Try to stop us!
Same Time Next Week

Your ‘friends’ broadcasts are simply stirring the pot. The lack of order risks everything we have built falling into anarchy. Perhaps this is the world you want to support, but we tell you clearly now. The path you take is a fatal one for the fate of humanity. We will strive to stop you, pilot. Know you have stirred our wrath.
Adhere to Order

Right! We’ve analyzed the Black Light weaponry you’ve stolen and can formulate a defense. The Sibelon have used ablative plates for centuries. These plates are attached over the hull and take a deal of the damage, but they can be removed and replaced later. They’re basic but they’re effective and you’ll need some more elements to create them.
Munitions

One last piece is needed for you to be able to craft these plates. We’re happy to say that these can be smashed from Imperial Sibelon Destroyers and then converted for your purpose. We know that the Imperial Fleet has an enclave nearby and that will be a prime target for these resources. Allowing you to develop the armor you need.
Imperial Enclave

Seems the tide is turning to our side finally, falcon. Whilst it would still be impossible to fight the Black Light head-to-head we can certainly fight them with guerilla tactics. Using these strikes out of nowhere to disrupt their forces and smuggling out innocents to new locations. With the help of the Sibelon Accord, there’s a real chance for humanity.
Fighting Chance

Given you’ve got as much chance of being captured as the rest of us, falcon, we’ve decided to make you a full member of the UEF. Which means there’s a whole new dealer in goods we’ve set up just for you. Allowing you to gather resources for the vital fights or purchase the items without needing to craft them. We hope that’s satisfactory?
New Trade

It’s time to fly the flag and mark our presence in the galaxy, falcon. Whilst you act on behalf of the UEF we truly accept that your actions are for the Sibelon Accord, Nyx and all the innocents that have lost their lives. We stand together for humanity and a resolution to the Black Light occupation. Let’s go out there and save lives.
Fly the Flag

We thank you for your complete and utter trust and we see a way forward from this point. From our contacts with the other alien races, the Black Light are internally disputing their occupation. Although the debate seems to be three sided. One who will stop at nothing, one who feel the occupation is an education and the third who want to leave.
Three Sides

The Sibelon Emperor has sought to ensure that all humans die, but that is not the will of our people. We have found an Imperial Sibelon ship under attack. If you go and rescue it, we will ensure this action is heard of amongst our people. Then we can start to lobby them and cause our people to start to rise up against the centuries old empire.
Lobby

The Black Light can’t suppress our communications without stopping their own. It gives them the type of quandary we want. A philosopher’s choice. I’m not sure that they are evil, per se, I just think they’ve had no way to remove the memory of the past. Perhaps, if we could find a way to release them from those memories, they would leave.
The Word was Solid

There is a way we can give them that freedom. A chance to be free of the past and look to themselves for their own resolutions. However, this is a modification of the technology which allows us to communicate without them prying. It is far too great a risk to supply that to them, as everything we have gained would be lost.
Unbound Issues

I need you to talk to Amita, but I think we should offer the companies one last chance to draw a truce. Even though they are controlled by puppets the actions we take may promote a new way of thinking in their people. They cannot all be slaves to the new regime, and yet again. Small steps will always get you home in the end.
A Last Cry

I tentatively agree with Nyx, but I really don’t want to. Whilst we respect the innocents who work under the company banner and have already helped many of them escape, we still have to deal with anyone who is aiding the occupation. If you can undertake the jobs they require then we can use them in this propaganda war!
If We Must!

We’ve been working hard with Nyx in order to get more support to our cause and I think we’ve achieved it. We need one more component for our system to go live. Once that has been gathered, you’ll have a new ally to help in the battle against the Black Light but one who can also help us infiltrate the company structure.
Before You Go!

Pilot. I am completely new and have no memories of the past, although I’ve been you worked with my previous incarnation. I’m very different now, even though I’ve been developed on the same scheme they used in the past. I think I should be better, but we’ll work that out as we proceed. Are you ready?
HULL 2.0

I’ve analyzed the information that I’ve been given and hacked into the company nets through old backdoors that my predecessor built. Given all the data at hand, I fail to see why he didn’t recognize that the Ministry influence was so deeply integrated into their systems and purposes. Therefore, I suggest we use the next few missions to gain the irrefutable truth.
Truth or Nothing

Our predecessors called you a vandal, pilot. Yet, now we have been given a better understanding of everything that has happened, we understand that you were working for the Black Light. If that was the case, your battles with our previous regime, in order to complete the change in this company have been valuable. Your aid is most welcome.
Vandal

The Black Light have grounded us and shown that our previous haughty attitude was wrong. We should understand the differences between us all far better and accept them. Clearly, what we achieved in the past concerned diversity, but created by our own hand. Now we must accept it all and our old should be renewed.
Above the Clouds

Well, the VRU are certainly a little… I think that word is unacceptable in my processing vocabulary. Let’s just say they seem to have accepted Black Light doctrine chapter and verse and I have a feeling the other companies may be as sheepish. I think its time to rattle the cage and then make contact with the EIC.
Lost in Doctrine

When we were young, we treated the world as if it was ours alone. Not understanding the error of our ways and how our rejection of the others started to cause the tensions after the Three-Day War. The Black Light have shown us that the Ministry were at the heart of our decisions and have eradicated that curse from our flesh.
All Are One

As we stand now, we see a new form beckon from beyond the veil. Our nature has started to change and with it, perhaps we see a new future for mankind, where the guidance of others will help us evolve. I hope you agree, pilot? Previously our old regime disliked you, but now we see you as one part in the greater whole.
New Form

‘The greater whole”! They really said that. I’ve considered my previous incarnation and he had a screw loose, but what the Black Light seem to be doing to humanity is to take all the fizz out and replace it with stagnation. Whatever humanities sins, you have to live with them and move on, or you can never really grow.
Really!?

The whole thing was broken, and we see a fresh birth happen. A new way to integrate with our fellow humans and work together towards a finer future. One where humans evolve to a higher plane of existence and what we have done becomes a note in history, rather than history itself. Perhaps the future is what we expected.
Birth of the Universe

The Black Light have offered us all Freedom’s Breath. A chance for us to revoke the Ministry from our minds and hearts and begin anew. They say it is a simple process, much like the flip of a switch, and then we will be restored and able to act for the greater whole. A new age is coming, pilot. Are you with us!
Freedom’s Breath

They’re coming. The Black Light. I can’t clearly identify what Freedom’s Breath is about, but it is at the heart of all the companies’ ideals. A place where their workforce will be changed for the ‘better’ by the Black Light. This is some form of indoctrination or worse and we need to stop it now. Warn our friends, we’re in trouble.
Solutions

HULL is right. We need to act now and end this madness and can only prove humanities worth by making the Black Light leave. There are certain ships of there’s which are identified with the Freedom’s Breath program. Get out there and target them, then seek the aid of the Sibelon Accord before speaking to Amita.
Act Now!

From what we can tell the Black Light are still internally analyzing their actions. This means an act against them may have a negative effect. That being said, it seems that we do not have a choice and the act of freeing your people can only occur by taking direct action. We can free up forces to support you if you can distract the Imperial Sibelon fleet.
Cold Way

Well, that certainly had an affect and has revealed our movement to the Sibelon Emperor. That is nothing to be concerned with, as it was destined to happen at some point. I feel it is necessary to stop striking at small targets and launch a full-scale attack. This is something you must do for your people’s freedom.
No More Peace

They’re all right and I’m recalling the fleet from their hidden locations. We will try and outsmart the enemy, as our forces are weaker. Although HULL has confirmed that some of those enslaved by the companies are ready to act as well. Disrupt company actions to allow them to be freed. Then once everything is ready… we attack!
Resigned

We’ve seeded sets of disinformation into every company, to cause disruption and used messages we’ve managed to adapt with the Black Light signature. Even some of our psionics – and yes, we have some – have managed to add those psychic traces to the messages to make them see authentic. One more action and we can start to move.
Sold On

We have managed to seize a few Black Light ships. I’ll explain how later, just know that we’ve outfitted them with not only out pilots but the technology to ensure they will go without trace. We are going to send them into areas of Black Light occupation and cause a ruse. So, their forces are made to scatter.
Misdirection

The Black Light tried to seize one of our heavy cruisers to get hold of the technology and the crew had no choice but to destroy themselves to protect those resources. Eighty-Seven people dead to ensure we maintain the advantage, not counting the countless other sacrifices. I think we’re disrupting them and their control.
Sacrifice!

Pilot. I have picked up a set of readings that troubles me greatly. I think the Black Light are planning to conjoin all their forces to pin down how we bypass their communications and hide from their ships. We can’t allow it to happen and we need to eliminate their capital ship, right now!
Mindscape

The Artemis and Shiva both attacked a main Black Light hub and destroyed it. Using their ships as blunt instruments and then detonating their drives, to create a maelstrom that engulfed everything. There was something else though, the massive energy burst seemed to also blank out the Black Light psionic powers for a couple of minutes. Is this our chance.
Desperate Honor

We have shown honor and patience and you keep standing against us. As if you wish to defend the Ministry, whose actions started this whole thing. There is nothing to defend and your inability to accept change means we have no choice but to apply the full extent of Freedom’s Breath. Say your goodbyes.
It Comes Now
This is an emergency beacon *STOP* Virus synthesizing in VRU systems *STOP* Need assistance *STOP* Objectives identified *STOP*
Alert! *STOP* VRU systems infected *STOP* Communications systems failing *STOP* Please assist. *STOP*

Pilot. Something seems to have synthesized itself in our systems; a virus we thought we’d eradicated. It seems that it’s affecting numerous programs throughout the VRU so be careful out there and make sure you eliminate any threat we identify. If we can contain this threat quickly, it shouldn’t blow out of proportion.
Battling the Virus

We’ve been given special clearance to speak to you. Whilst you may be on the grubbier end of the spectrum it appears this virus is affecting us all. Therefore, on this one occasion your organization has revoked the Warbond and is allowing you to work for us. Be warned, pilot, we are monitoring your actions. Keep your nose clean.

We’ve agreed with your imperialist masters that you can work for us on this occasion. Please note we will be monitoring our assets carefully and be warned, if we are not united in our response, the virus could adapt and spread into all ship systems, leaving us open to attack. Often we have to take a path that is less beaten.

The virus seems to be spreading further. The same one that affected the P.E.T.s in the past, which is strange as our science division said they’d eradicated it. Because of the special circumstances and the threat to all humanities defense systems we’re going to also call in MMO and EIC pilots and suspend the Warbond.
Special Clearance

Not as efficient as VRU pilots by any stretch of the imagination but you’ve done the job. Although I think some training in etiquette would help, as our hanger staff have been complaining about oil marks in the docking bays. This virus is similar to the P.E.T. virus, which we thought we’d eradicated. Perhaps the EIC released a sample.

Although we appreciate your help, please don’t have ideas above your station. Whilst we’re happy for you to share our information this does not mean you can broadcast EIC propaganda throughout our space, so make sure you calm that shit down. Seems this virus is the one that affected P.E.T.s previously. Thought we’d killed that one.

If we can’t pin down this virus soon there’s no end to the damage it can cause. Four of our officers Augmented Reality headsets went on the blink, meaning they ejected themselves from an airlock because they thought they were heading to the refectory. It’s essential we pin this virus down as soon as possible.
Spread Mechanics

We’ve tracked down the reason this viral strain is spreading but not where it stemmed from. Although we think there have been equal problems in your organization. Still, this does not stop the fact that we need to stop this thing, and you MMO people are used to getting your hands dirty, so best you get on with it.

We may have some information about the release of the virus, and believe me, the EIC are just as much to blame. However, we still haven’t uncovered the root of the infection. Which is something we’ll be tasking you all with as we move forward. However, suppression of the infection is the first thing on the cards.

As embarrassing as it is for us to admit, it appears that the virus spread in our systems because one of our staff thought it would be very post-modern to make their password, ‘password’! A person who has now been incarcerated for a considerable period of time. So we’ll take some responsibility for the virus’ spread.
Reactivating the Strain

We’ve had a theory and want to test something out. We’re not sure if this will affect anything on your ship but, let’s face facts, you MMO are always talking about how tough you are. Best be prepared all the same as your blunt tactics are proving useful. Once you have resolved your objectives come back to us.

Every time you respond to us, it’s like we’re hearing a voice from the past. You must try and stop the EIC imperialist rot and just respond like a normal human being. We have a test for you to complete, it may be dangerous but that’s what you people are all about, isn’t it? Get out there and complete the objectives and tell us the results.

Our scientists have managed to pin down a flaw in the viral makeup so we can test some counter measures. Creating some areas where P.E.T.s don’t work. We need you to check this region out to confirm that everything is going according to plan and then destroy another two of the rogue P.E.T.s so we can gather samples in isolation.
Counter Measures

Not bad, pilot. A little bit direct, but you Martians are all the same. Keeping things simple and leaving the proper science to people like the great VRU. However, the theory we were testing hasn’t worked as expected. The virus has rebuffed some of our attempts and so we need more samples to discover what is controlling this infection.

You certainly make your point, pilot. Not the way we’d do it, a little bit too much derring-do rather than efficient logical thinking. You got the job done and so it’s now become clear that something else is controlling the virus, as our anti-viral program is not taking full effect. Time to investigate further and gather more evidence.

So part of that worked, part didn’t. We’re much closer to reestablishing vital systems throughout the VRU now, using the tech we discovered to aid their protection. The issue is what is controlling these damn P.E.T.s. We sent out an anti-virus and it just seems to have hit a brick wall. Better get us some more evidence to analyze.
Controlling Factor

Seems there’s an ‘Alpha’ out there who is controlling all the others. Which has seemingly created a backdoor into the rogue P.E.T.s systems. Meaning the only way to stop this viral infection is to kill the alpha and then deploy the anti-virus again, before anything can adapt. You’ll need to work hard, but that’s the MMO doctrine, isn’t it?

We’ve uncovered the root of the problem and it appears that there’s an alpha P.E.T. out there somewhere, which is managing to operate a backdoor in the rogue P.E.T.s you’ve encountered. It’s important we pin this threat down as soon as possible so we can bring things back to normal and stop depending on outside help!

If all our calculations are correct it looks like there’s an Alpha P.E.T. behind all of this, although we have no idea who created it. We may be wrong but it seems to suggest a more advanced technology than the VRU. Once it’s been eradicated things should settle down but we need to pinpoint it first and that’s where you come in!
Alpha Alert

I guess you’ll be happy to know that this Alpha seems to have been created by a cross company failure. Whilst we eradicated the virus before, a number of units were too deep in space to be affected. In turn they adapted and created the Alpha P.E.T.s which are now causing us so many problems.

So, it appears that the reason for the existence of these ‘Alpha’s’ is due to a failure of all the companies to clean up their mess after the previous infection. A group of P.E.T.s left isolated and allowed to adapt and reform into a more powerful force. I guess this is what we pay for constant improvement.

I know some of you have been asking but this P.E.T. problem doesn’t appear to be linked to other events, it just seems that when the eradication signal was sent out when this happened previously, it didn’t reach a bunch of P.E.T.s in deep space. Where they adapted and formed a new Alpha, based on all the companies' tech.
Other Agendas

I know how your MMO techs will view this but for the VRU we are delighted to have discovered a new protocol from the ashes of these events. One that will certainly enhance P.E.T.s in the future. So, your blunt actions have proven useful but, in reality, you are hardly the type of pilot we would be expecting to join the VRU.

We’re just waiting for the EIC to pompously announce that they found this first but rest assured the VRU are the ones who discovered the new protocol in the heart of all this madness. Seems that something good has come about from your actions, and I bet you can’t say that often when working for your normal bosses.

It appears that what harms us may also act as a boon. The rogue P.E.T.’s are showing higher Protocols which we can definitely utilize. If these events have proven one thing it’s that the VRU policy of constant adaptation is a powerful ally when creating new technology. But be reassured, your role here will not be ignored.
A New Protocol

Well, I can’t say it’s been nice but you’ve definitely done a job and so, if you destroy the Alpha P.E.T. we’ll reward you with a special treat. Let’s just call it something to remember us by. Now please remove all your greasy items from the pilots lounge and get the hell out of our region of space. I’m sure the MMO have their own problems!

Now that your tasks are nearly complete, just that Alpha P.E.T. to defeat, I’d say it’s time we advise you that you'll receive a special prize. Well, we know an imperialist like you won’t be happy but I’m sure if you do some work for the ‘glorious’ EIC and MMO as well you may get something better.

Now we’ve pinned the Alpha P.E.T. down it’s time to obliterate it and we’ve created a special treat for you, to celebrate your coming victory. So it’s time to go and face that beast so we can lose this business and start our independent operations up again. I’ve also heard if you aid the MMO and EIC you may be able to combine the P.E.T.’s together!
P.E.T End
This is an emergency beacon *STOP* Virus synthesizing in VRU systems *STOP* Need assistance *STOP* Objectives identified *STOP*
Alert! *STOP* VRU systems infected *STOP* Communications systems failing *STOP* Please assist. *STOP*

Pilot. Something seems to have synthesized itself in our systems; a virus we thought we’d eradicated. It seems that it’s affecting numerous programs throughout the VRU so be careful out there and make sure you eliminate any threat we identify. If we can contain this threat quickly, it shouldn’t blow out of proportion.
Battling the Virus

We’ve been given special clearance to speak to you. Whilst you may be on the grubbier end of the spectrum it appears this virus is affecting us all. Therefore, on this one occasion your organization has revoked the Warbond and is allowing you to work for us. Be warned, pilot, we are monitoring your actions. Keep your nose clean.

We’ve agreed with your imperialist masters that you can work for us on this occasion. Please note we will be monitoring our assets carefully and be warned, if we are not united in our response, the virus could adapt and spread into all ship systems, leaving us open to attack. Often we have to take a path that is less beaten.

The virus seems to be spreading further. The same one that affected the P.E.T.s in the past, which is strange as our science division said they’d eradicated it. Because of the special circumstances and the threat to all humanities defense systems we’re going to also call in MMO and EIC pilots and suspend the Warbond.
Special Clearance

Not as efficient as VRU pilots by any stretch of the imagination but you’ve done the job. Although I think some training in etiquette would help, as our hanger staff have been complaining about oil marks in the docking bays. This virus is similar to the P.E.T. virus, which we thought we’d eradicated. Perhaps the EIC released a sample.

Although we appreciate your help, please don’t have ideas above your station. Whilst we’re happy for you to share our information this does not mean you can broadcast EIC propaganda throughout our space, so make sure you calm that shit down. Seems this virus is the one that affected P.E.T.s previously. Thought we’d killed that one.

If we can’t pin down this virus soon there’s no end to the damage it can cause. Four of our officers Augmented Reality headsets went on the blink, meaning they ejected themselves from an airlock because they thought they were heading to the refectory. It’s essential we pin this virus down as soon as possible.
Spread Mechanics

We’ve tracked down the reason this viral strain is spreading but not where it stemmed from. Although we think there have been equal problems in your organization. Still, this does not stop the fact that we need to stop this thing, and you MMO people are used to getting your hands dirty, so best you get on with it.

We may have some information about the release of the virus, and believe me, the EIC are just as much to blame. However, we still haven’t uncovered the root of the infection. Which is something we’ll be tasking you all with as we move forward. However, suppression of the infection is the first thing on the cards.

As embarrassing as it is for us to admit, it appears that the virus spread in our systems because one of our staff thought it would be very post-modern to make their password, ‘password’! A person who has now been incarcerated for a considerable period of time. So we’ll take some responsibility for the virus’ spread.
Reactivating the Strain

We’ve had a theory and want to test something out. We’re not sure if this will affect anything on your ship but, let’s face facts, you MMO are always talking about how tough you are. Best be prepared all the same as your blunt tactics are proving useful. Once you have resolved your objectives come back to us.

Every time you respond to us, it’s like we’re hearing a voice from the past. You must try and stop the EIC imperialist rot and just respond like a normal human being. We have a test for you to complete, it may be dangerous but that’s what you people are all about, isn’t it? Get out there and complete the objectives and tell us the results.

Our scientists have managed to pin down a flaw in the viral makeup so we can test some counter measures. Creating some areas where P.E.T.s don’t work. We need you to check this region out to confirm that everything is going according to plan and then destroy another two of the rogue P.E.T.s so we can gather samples in isolation.
Counter Measures

Not bad, pilot. A little bit direct, but you Martians are all the same. Keeping things simple and leaving the proper science to people like the great VRU. However, the theory we were testing hasn’t worked as expected. The virus has rebuffed some of our attempts and so we need more samples to discover what is controlling this infection.

You certainly make your point, pilot. Not the way we’d do it, a little bit too much derring-do rather than efficient logical thinking. You got the job done and so it’s now become clear that something else is controlling the virus, as our anti-viral program is not taking full effect. Time to investigate further and gather more evidence.

So part of that worked, part didn’t. We’re much closer to reestablishing vital systems throughout the VRU now, using the tech we discovered to aid their protection. The issue is what is controlling these damn P.E.T.s. We sent out an anti-virus and it just seems to have hit a brick wall. Better get us some more evidence to analyze.
Controlling Factor

Seems there’s an ‘Alpha’ out there who is controlling all the others. Which has seemingly created a backdoor into the rogue P.E.T.s systems. Meaning the only way to stop this viral infection is to kill the alpha and then deploy the anti-virus again, before anything can adapt. You’ll need to work hard, but that’s the MMO doctrine, isn’t it?

We’ve uncovered the root of the problem and it appears that there’s an alpha P.E.T. out there somewhere, which is managing to operate a backdoor in the rogue P.E.T.s you’ve encountered. It’s important we pin this threat down as soon as possible so we can bring things back to normal and stop depending on outside help!

If all our calculations are correct it looks like there’s an Alpha P.E.T. behind all of this, although we have no idea who created it. We may be wrong but it seems to suggest a more advanced technology than the VRU. Once it’s been eradicated things should settle down but we need to pinpoint it first and that’s where you come in!
Alpha Alert

I guess you’ll be happy to know that this Alpha seems to have been created by a cross company failure. Whilst we eradicated the virus before, a number of units were too deep in space to be affected. In turn they adapted and created the Alpha P.E.T.s which are now causing us so many problems.

So, it appears that the reason for the existence of these ‘Alpha’s’ is due to a failure of all the companies to clean up their mess after the previous infection. A group of P.E.T.s left isolated and allowed to adapt and reform into a more powerful force. I guess this is what we pay for constant improvement.

I know some of you have been asking but this P.E.T. problem doesn’t appear to be linked to other events, it just seems that when the eradication signal was sent out when this happened previously, it didn’t reach a bunch of P.E.T.s in deep space. Where they adapted and formed a new Alpha, based on all the companies' tech.
Other Agendas

I know how your MMO techs will view this but for the VRU we are delighted to have discovered a new protocol from the ashes of these events. One that will certainly enhance P.E.T.s in the future. So, your blunt actions have proven useful but, in reality, you are hardly the type of pilot we would be expecting to join the VRU.

We’re just waiting for the EIC to pompously announce that they found this first but rest assured the VRU are the ones who discovered the new protocol in the heart of all this madness. Seems that something good has come about from your actions, and I bet you can’t say that often when working for your normal bosses.

It appears that what harms us may also act as a boon. The rogue P.E.T.’s are showing higher Protocols which we can definitely utilize. If these events have proven one thing it’s that the VRU policy of constant adaptation is a powerful ally when creating new technology. But be reassured, your role here will not be ignored.
A New Protocol

Well, I can’t say it’s been nice but you’ve definitely done a job and so, if you destroy the Alpha P.E.T. we’ll reward you with a special treat. Let’s just call it something to remember us by. Now please remove all your greasy items from the pilots lounge and get the hell out of our region of space. I’m sure the MMO have their own problems!

Now that your tasks are nearly complete, just that Alpha P.E.T. to defeat, I’d say it’s time we’d advise you that we have a prize we’ll give you. Well, we know an imperialist like you won’t be happy but I’m sure if you do some work for the ‘glorious’ EIC and MMO as well you may get something better.

Now we’ve pinned the Alpha P.E.T. down it’s time to obliterate it and we’ve created a special treat for you, to celebrate your coming victory. So it’s time to go and face that beast so we can lose this business and start our independent operations up again. I’ve also heard if you aid the MMO and EIC you may be able to combine the P.E.T.’s together!
P.E.T End

Citizen. It appears that we have had a viral outbreak, which is spreading quickly across our subsystems. Luckily, MMO technology is built with redundancies in mind, so we’ve managed to replace many of those systems to maintain a working operation. However, guess what, we need you to investigate!

Please stand by! Normal service will resume shortly. Your call is valuable to us! Please stand…. Can anyone out there hear me? Need help… failure… Computer virus spreading through… systems. Assist please!

Welcome to Mars Mining Operations. Your call is held in a queue and will be answered shortly! If you require further assistance… This is a General Distress Call. Help. We’ve got system wide failures. Can you assist us?
Outbreak

Much as we don’t appreciate the EIC and VRU it seems that this global problem will require us to work together to resolve this problem. Therefore, pilots of the other companies may also be helping resolve this. We need to be pragmatic about this process so we’d appreciate it if you concentrate on the rogue P.E.T.s.
Oh, thank god. So pleased… able to assist… Communications systems… failing. P.E.T.s appear… rogue. Giving… MMO clearance… assist.

Who’d have thought that you VRU tech-heads would be helping out the MMO. Still, as we say. ‘Union is Power’ so it seems we’re in the same boat. We’re not asking you to sign up with us but perhaps you can still assist in dealing with this rogue P.E.T. problem.
Clearance Given

This virus seems to be spreading. My wife told me that the auto-cook tried to chop her up this morning – although the company who made it are associated with the EIC, so no surprise. If things keep escalating even the robust MMO systems may be at threat. So, we need you to act quickly to solve things, my friend.
Issues… spreading. Vital you still… We could die… assistance. Please don’t abandon us. We revoke… Warbond in this situation… Work… solve problem. Continue to aid…

I hear you had some issues with the cleanliness of our facilities. Perhaps you’ve not seen a real days work in your life, where people actually act together, rather than merely adapt their surroundings. Still, for now the Warbond has been lifted and, despite better judgement, your help is ‘welcome’. So show us what you’ve got.
Escalation

Much as we like to keep things simple here in the MMO it doesn’t help when our citizens take that too literally. The virus appears to have spread from an unknown source that one of our staff opened. Apparently, a prince who needed his family’s riches protected. Clearly false. By identifying the source, we can hopefully find a cure.

Communications systems… stabilizing. Failure… security. Thanks for your help, comrade. There’s still much to do but if you can consider working for us further we’ll make sure you are rewarded. Although we have issues with the EIC, you seem to understand our values in the MMO. Now please complete the tasks we have set.

It appears the virus was released into our systems by a failure on each company’s part. Yes, even your precious VRU, technical wizards that you are, have added to this problem. Let it be known that the MMO take responsibility for our issues. Rewarding you for any actions you undertake. Just show us what you can do.
The Curse of Security

Citizen. We’ve managed to pin down the issues and generally clear MMO systems of immediate threats. I can’t say the other two companies have acted as quickly, but we still have a problem to deal with and so cannot take advantage of the situation. We need to test our findings. Please get out there and do your job!

Seems that MMO command have utilized a fix, which has brought most of our systems back online. The rogue P.E.T.’s are still a problem though. Your assistance is still worthwhile and almost valued. Let me clarify. Your imperialist leaders still subjugate their workers but perhaps you can see the benefits of working with the MMO?

Were in the process of administering a galaxy wide fix. Well before the VRU have made one of their own, I might add. It seems that the fix still hasn’t impacted on the rogue P.E.T.s out there so we still need your assistance in helping eradicate this problem, once and for all. I hope you’re ready to do a proper days work?
Taking Advantage

The information you gathered is useful, citizen, but we’re still unclear what is controlling these rogue P.E.T.s. As the tests we performed based on the valuable evidence you gathered, did not manage to stop these devices. It’s almost as if there is something else out there controlling their very nature. Can you do some more investigating for us?

Well, seems the virus had a more complex structure than we thought. Potentially linked to the viral outbreak of the past. Although who can say how that managed to recur, as we thought it had been eradicated. Until we have identified the source of things, we need you to keep assisting the MMO. So please follow the mission instructions.

When things bubble up from the past it really annoys us. The MMO appreciate simple systems we all can understand, equality in the workforce and a true future for mankind. It appears that the viral outbreak of the past, where P.E.T.s went rogue is equally responsible for this outbreak. Even your help is valuable in bringing about a resolution.
Puppet Master

Seems we might have a main P.E.T. out there who keeps rewriting the others protocols, ensuring we can’t control them. Whatever the method, it simply appears that these P.E.T.s need to be destroyed. Nothing else will resolve the issue now and if we can’t stop the source, we’ll never stop the infection. Please act in our best interests, citizen.

All the evidence is pointing to something else rewriting the code of the rogue P.E.T.s as everything the MMO throws at them is overridden. When it was first formed the EIC created this type of back-door, in order to control their people. Not that we’re blaming you, pilot, you’re just a pawn in their plans. Better to help us with ours.

With the evidence you’ve gathered and with a bit of co-ordination with the other companies, which the MMO arranged of course, we can see that there appears to be another, more powerful, P.E.T. out there. We’re hoping you can keep your agenda clear to help us finally solve these problems and will honor our agreements if you finish the job.
Top of the Tree

It appears that this problem is of our own making. Whilst others have recently raised their heads, like the Ministry, as well as the continued elimination of our facilities on the Rim, it appears this is down to us. We should have cleaned out the deepest regions of space, where these P.E.T.s have been slowly adapting themselves. We will learn from our errors.

The MMO are sure a companywide issue throughout the known galaxy created these events. So we’re all to blame but whilst the EIC blusters about and the VRU seem to fail to acknowledge their part of this the MMO have taken action. We still need you to prove you’re better than the rest of your organization so please continue.

I know you’re proud of the genetic spread of the VRU but let me be clear to you. It’s the MMO who started negotiations to finally end this issue and it will be the MMO who people trust in the future. We’re willing to admit our hand in this problem, as it appears P.E.T.s were missed during the last outbreak. Please resolve this.
Of Our Own Making

Citizen. The earlier reports about unusual protocols have made us analyze the data we gathered and realize that a new Protocol for the P.E.T.s is possible. We’re delighted to share this news for you and have also been developing a special reward for you, once this crisis is over. You’re almost there, comrade. You’re almost there.

It seems what we’re learning from our research is that new protocols may be available. Ones that we’ll be ensuring aid the MMO pilots as they reach further towards the stars in order to spread our word of unity. I know you’re sad your imperialist company cannot say the same. Nevertheless, we’re planning a great reward when all is done.

The techs at MMO HQ have defined a new level of protocol from the evidence you and our pilots gathered. Clearly, the MMO gathered more of the vital evidence. Which means potential enhancements to P.E.T.’s. Helping us spread the word of our efficiency further. Time to complete the last couple of jobs for us, before you go.
Practical Results

The final mission we have for you will pit you against this rogue Alpha P.E.T. To commemorate your victory we’ve managed to develop something special for you. One that, when integrated with the rewards that the EIC and VRU are providing, might just be equally rewarding. Just remember that the tech at the heart is still MMO!

Before we re-establish the Warbond it is important to recognize your services to the MMO. So once you’ve taken out the Alpha P.E.T. we’ll give you something special, to commemorate your time with us. We know in the future you’ll realize we’re the better organization. Now head out and destroy the final threat.

We have to grudgingly admit that you’ve been helpful. Although your sense of etiquette is far too overdeveloped for the workings of our trueborn people. However it is good to show you the other and better way of doing things and before the Warbond is established we’d like to thank you for your help. Now tidy up this last thing.
Battle for Control

Citizen. It appears that we have had a viral outbreak, which is spreading quickly across our subsystems. Luckily, MMO technology is built with redundancies in mind, so we’ve managed to replace many of those systems to maintain a working operation. However, guess what, we need you to investigate!

Before we re-establish the Warbond it is important to recognize your services to the MMO. So once you’ve taken out the Alpha P.E.T. we’ll give you something special, to commemorate your time with us. We know in the future you’ll realize we’re the better organization. Now head out and destroy the final threat.

We have to grudgingly admit that you’ve been helpful. Although your sense of etiquette is far too overdeveloped for the workings of our trueborn people. However it is good to show you the other and better way of doing things and before the Warbond is established we’d like to thank you for your help. Now tidy up this last thing.
Battle for Control

Good Day. This is a General Distress Call from Earth Industries Corporation. It appears we’re having a spot of bother with a few of our machines. If someone out there could help us out that would be wonderful. No need to rush… Well to be honest if you could rush a little that would be awfully helpful.

Pilots of the EIC. We need to inform you of some technical problems we’ve discovered in the last few days which seem to be spreading through our systems. I think we’ve been hacked. It appears that some of our technology has gone haywire so it would be great if you could get out there and help. This is not a request!

Hey there pilots. Something has gone wrong with my mum’s communications array. Which means I can broadcast into VRU territory from EIC military comms. What a rush! I just wanted to say that we all think you in the VRU stink! But mum is asking if you can help us out anyway, as the washing machine appears to be on the blink!
Empirical Data

Smashing job there, pilot. I always thought that you MMO people were a little bit backwards but it seems you know how to complete a mission. I’d just like to explain that I’m not officially speaking on behalf of the EIC, but I’m sure, given the circumstances, that we can ask for more of your aid. “Bound for Victory”, as we say! You ready?

Captain, I’m releasing you from the Warbond for now. It appears this virus has affected all the EIC communications and all and sundry are broadcasting out and seeking aid. Some of the other main companies have come to their aid too. There’s a lot going on at the moment and as we try and get control back, we have another mission for you.

It’s so cool I’m telling you what to do. While the image on your communication screen is still the high commander. So now pilot, you’re working for me and will follow my instructions! Oops, sorry of that sounded all official, it’s my first time doing this. You can call me Billy if that helps. I seem to be getting emergency signals, can you help them out?
War of Words

Well done you! It appears you managed to smash those blighters to smithereens. You MMO people are quite blunt when dealing with this stuff. It also appears that P.E.T.s seem to be infected as well. Heard that they’re going rogue all across space. Hope you’re the person to deal with this while I mix myself an itty bitty cocktail.

Believe me pilot, however bad you think things are at your end, they’re a million-and-one times worse here. We’ve got all types of idiots flooding our feed, yet luckily they seem to be directing pilots from the other factions. This problem seems to be spreading and so we need to get on top of things now, before they really go out of control.

Even for smelly old VRU you seem a little cool. But, don’t let my dad catch my dad saying that. I just keep getting all these distress signals about P.E.T.s here on my panel and am forwarding them to you and the other pilots out there. I reckon I could do this as a job. Let me try my important voice again. ‘Your company needs you. Act now!’
P.E.T. Problems

Shame you’re not here to share a drink. I do seem to be all alone with this communication feed and the bar, which I accidently was locked into. Still, I see myself as looking after the place, so I guess the owner owes me a few drinks. Something here says a young Boy called Billy released the virus. Guess he’ll be in trouble, like we’ll be without your help!

The virus seems to have been sitting dormant in an application which need a special code to trigger it, and one child in the EIC seems to have managed to unlock that code. This simply is not my day, I’m going to have to cancel my dinner plans. Although there seem to be leaks in MMO and VRU territories too. Please try to stem the problems.

So, I was playing this game, and then I saw this hack sheet online and decided to try it out so I could top the leaderboards. So awesome being inside the code and found this thing called a ‘Doomsday Code’, so I triggered it. After that, the communications started redirecting themselves. How awesome was that?
Released into the Wild

Well, that dry martini went down awfully well and I’ve found a book on how to make other cocktails. So I’m about to have a fabulous time. What’s that you say. Next objective. Well, my next objective is to get outrageously… Oh! Your next objective! Why didn’t you say? I’ve sent it to your mission objectives panel. Looks like a lot of fun.

The boffins have come up with a plan, which might disrupt the P.E.T.s, as they seem to be the main source of the infection. If you can follow the instructions in the mission objectives, we can hopefully quell this and stop it turning into a disaster. Luckily, it’s affecting all the companies so there’s no chance of a pre-emptive strike.

Mum is telling me I need to go to bed soon. I think that stinks and I told her that I was doing vital stuff for the EIC. Not sure she believed me, she also said she has had some messages from EIC Command asking about my name. Like I started this whole problem, duh! Anyway, you have a mission to do, get to it.
Close Down

The screen is a little blurred, but I think it says here that your last mission was an unmitigated success. Congratulations, you! Unfortunately, even though you were successful it appears the problems are still ongoing. This is thirsty work. Wonder who’s controlling those P.E.T.s. Sounds like a job for my favorite pilot, eh!

The data you gathered there was invaluable. It definitely proves that there’s another source, which is overwriting the antiviral code we created. One that seems to be coming from deep space. We’re starting to get the communication streams back in control now, which means we’ll be able to triangulate our methods better. Get back out there!

No, mum, no! I need to tell the VRU pilot what to do next. I know it’s past my bedtime but pleeaassee. You always said I had a lot of potential, so look. I’m using my potential now. Pilot, I think there’s another source of the virus out there you need to suppress. Mum tells me I’ve got to get ready for bed now.
Out of Control

So, we’re the best team, aren’t we. You doing the action out there and me monitoring you from this lovely bar, with all its lovely drinks. This one is green, it looks just like a big, big… erm… green thing. Now, on the special screen it says there may be an Alpha P.E.T. What’s one of those then? I wonder if it’s in my cocktail book?

Everything is pointing to a rogue Alpha P.E.T. out there. Although we’ll need to pin down its location and we can only do this with your dedicated aid. We’re planning a special reward for you when this is all over, pilot. The team in the labs have become quite excited about what you might have discovered. More later. Act now!

This is Billy’s mum. I’m not sure what he’s told you but he’s been a very, very, very naughty boy. If he’s responsible for all of this then I don’t know what his dad is going to say. It also tells me you’re a VRU pilot, I’m not sure I should even be talking to you. Sorry? The next mission! Well press accept and get on with it then.
Top Dog

I think I’m a little bit tipsy. It’s like every bottle has a myriad of glowing stars which are making me a little dizzy and… Sorry, just fell off my chair. I’d say that this whole thing is our own fault. We create new things and then they come and attack us. It’s like the movies, we’re all going to die. Sorry, sorry, I’ll compose myself a little better next time!

Given the effects of this virus have affected most of humanity I don’t think they relate to anything but the precious time the P.E.T’s went wild. This just shows what happens when you don’t clean up properly. Although the weight of the blame obviously lands in the MMO and VRU’s hands. A few more missions and we’ll be clear.

No, no! I’m still here. Apparently your transmission is just coming straight back to Billy’s computer now. I’ve been told to keep feeding you information… just let me read this… ‘Even though you are a mortal enemy!’ Did you follow that? It says there are a few missions to complete still. Here’s the next one.
None of Your Concern

Whatcha sayin’? Do I even know you… or trust you. Well, you have a nice voice and I really, really like nice voices. Like nectar on a rainy day. Tee he! Think they’re going to take back control from me now. But, sshhhh! I didn’t tell you but I think they’ve uncovered a new P.E.T. protocol. Whatever that is it sounds neat! Hic!

Really glad this is coming to an end, pilot. With the failure in communications systems and a selection of other problems, we seem to be finally getting control of this thing. The other companies have even done their minor parts. Surprising I know! That think we discovered in the lab. Seems we’ve uncovered a new P.E.T. protocol!

The EIC say they’re going to be taking back control of communications in the next few minutes, so I’ll say goodbye now, before you go. I quite enjoyed telling you what to do for a while, seems better than my job as a manager of a space haulage firm. There’s talk here of a new P.E.T. protocol. Good luck on your travels!
Laboratory Analysis

This is EIC Command. We’ve regained control of this communications channel and would like to assure you that the person you were speaking to was not representative of our office. We appreciate your help at this difficult time and would like to reward you for your actions. Please destroy the rogue Alpha P.E.T. to receive this reward!

Finally, we have control of all our communications channels again. Thanks for your patience and help, pilot. You’ve done the EIC proud in this difficult time. It’s hard to put a value on what you’ve done but our accounting division have done just that, and we’ve a special reward for you if you just kill that damn rogue Alpha P.E.T.

Greetings, pilot. We have to thank you for your assistance at this trying time and apologize for the junior spaceman who seems to have been ordering you about. It is not our policy to allow communications to fail, but I think you’re aware of the circumstances. If you destroy that Alpha P.E.T. then we’ll reward you well.
Final Call

Good Day. This is a General Distress Call from Earth Industries Corporation. It appears we’re having a spot of bother with a few of our machines. If someone out there could help us out that would be wonderful. No need to rush… Well to be honest if you could rush a little that would be awfully helpful.

It is not our policy to allow communications to fail, but I think you’re aware of the circumstances. If you destroy that Alpha P.E.T. then we’ll reward you well.
Final Call

Son konuşmamızın üzerinden hayli zaman geçti sanırım pilot. Yeni arkadaşlar edindin de beni mi görmezden geliyorsun diye merak ediyordum. Yine de endişeye lüzum yok, artık buradasın ve birlikte çalışıp uzaylı tehdidine karşı koymaya yardım edebiliriz. Şimdi, sen onları ödüller için geri püskürtürken ben de gözcülerimden birkaç tanesini bölgedeki teknoloji değişikliklerini taraması için göndereyim! Anlaştık mı?
Teknoloji Alışverişi

Son zamanlarda adına çalıştığın diğer insanlar konusunda endişeliyim. Onlarla çalışırken terbiyen bozulabilirdi, kötü alışkanlıklar da cabası! Çok daha uyumlu diğer arkadaşlarınla çalışman senin için daha iyi olur, mesela Nyx ve tabii ki ben. Diğerlerinin etkilerini kontrol altında tut. Biz arkandayız, bunu unutma!
Tesirin Yayılması

Tehlikeli bir oyun oynuyoruz şu an, ellerimizde bıçakla karanlıkta koşuşturuyoruz sanki. Uzaylıları püskürtüyoruz ama her seferinde daha fazlası bölgemize akın etmeye devam ediyor. Kendi dünyalarında bir şeyler ters gidiyor olmalı çünkü hem birbirlerine hem de insanlığa karşı savaş alanında olmayı tercih ediyorlar. Bir şeyler değişiyor ve bu hiç de iyi değil.
Bıçaklarla Koşmak

Harika bir iş başardın pilot. Uzaylılara karşı koyup mesajı aldıklarından emin oldun. Yine de içinizden birkaçının hâlâ kendini kanıtlamak istediğini biliyorum. Bu yüzden lütfen uzaydaki bölgelerimizde güvenliği sağlayarak bu fırsatı değerlendirin. Ticari ve sivil gemilerin güvenli geçiş yapmalarını kolaylaştırın.
Tepenin Kralı

Son konuşmamızın üzerinden hayli zaman geçti sanırım pilot. Yeni arkadaşlar edindin de beni mi görmezden geliyorsun diye merak ediyordum. Bu yüzden lütfen uzaydaki bölgelerimizde güvenliği sağlayarak bu fırsatı değerlendirin. Ticari ve sivil gemilerin güvenli geçiş yapmalarını kolaylaştırın.
Tepenin Kralı

Merhaba pilot! Konuşmayalı uzun zaman oldu. Şirket işlerini ele alıp galaksiyi tekrar kontrol etmemizi sağlamanın vakti geldi. Bunun için bazı kutular toplayıp tehdit oluşturan uzaylıları haklamanı istiyoruz!
Keyif Kutusu

Hmmm. Biraz hamlamışsın. Beklediğimiz verimi alamadığımız için sana başka bir iş ayarladık. Hemen önlem alıp şirket standardımızı ve güçlü ideallerimizi korumalıyız. Zira, ideallerimizden önemli bir şey olamaz!
İlerleme, Mükemmelleştirir

Seni sınama vakti geldi. Git ve tüm pilotlarımıza verdiğimiz görevi yerine getir. Bunu, önümüzdeki dört yılın standardını belirleyecek olan Uzay Kupası'nın testi olarak gör. Harekete geçmeye hazır mısın? Biz de öyle düşündük!
Dört Yıllık Anlaşma

Bazı kaynakların toplanması gerekiyor. Sırf gelişmen için değil. Bu sayede gelişimini şirkete kanıtlamış olacaksın. Gelecekte bu durumla övünebilirsin. Övündüğün şey, şirketimiz için çalışmak olsun ki hep arkanda olalım.
Kaos Toplama
Olaylar geliştikçe, şirketimizin galaksiyi tehditlerden arındırmada büyük rol oynadığı ortaya çıktı. Bizi tehdit eden diğer güçlerden hiç haber alamadık. Yani yaptıklarımız, yaptıkların, önemli!
Mücadeleye Hazır
Sıradaki mücadelenin üstesinden gelebileceğini düşünüyoruz. Düşmanlar için gözlerini dört aç ve görevini tamamlarken kimseye acıma. Bu da hallolduğuna göre, geleceğini konuşmaya başlayabiliriz!
Acımak Yok

Eski bir oyunu oynama vakti. Diğer şirketlerin yaptıklarımıza nasıl tepkiler verdiğini görmek istiyoruz. Pek fazla bir şey çıkacağını sanmıyoruz. Ancak. Bizim yalnız silahşorumuzun meydana çıkıp gerçek hasar yaratma vakti geldi!
Eski Oyun

Şimdi, harekete geçmek için doğru zaman gibi görünüyor. Yükselme zamanımız geldi. Bu Uzay Kupası, bulunmaz bir fırsat! Bazı şirketler işin eğlencesinde olsa da, bizce bu profesyonel bir mesele. Profesyonel ol!
Doğru Zaman
Bu şirketin efsanesi olma vaktin geldi. Bu fırsat her pilotun eline geçmez. Şanslı pilotlar arasındasın. Bizim dilimizden anlıyorsun. Git ve savaş!
Efsane ol
Evet pilot, aynen öyle. Git, hasar ver ve tecrübe kazan. Bu sırada medya ekiplerimiz en iyi pilotun başarılarını dört bir yana duyuruyor olacak. Zamana meydan oku!
Zamana Meydan Okumak

Merhaba pilot! Konuşmayalı uzun zaman oldu. Şirket işlerini ele alıp galaksiyi tekrar kontrol etmemizi sağlamanın vakti geldi. Bunun için bazı kutular toplayıp tehdit oluşturan uzaylıları haklamanı istiyoruz!
Keyif Kutusu

Seni sınama vakti geldi. Git ve tüm pilotlarımıza verdiğimiz görevi yerine getir. Bunu, önümüzdeki dört yılın standardını belirleyecek olan Uzay Kupası'nın testi olarak gör. Harekete geçmeye hazır mısın? Biz de öyle düşündük!
Dört Yıllık Anlaşma

Bazı kaynakların toplanması gerekiyor. Sırf gelişmen için değil. Bu sayede gelişimini şirkete kanıtlamış olacaksın. Gelecekte bu durumla övünebilirsin. Övündüğün şey, şirketimiz için çalışmak olsun ki hep arkanda olalım.
Kaos Toplama
Olaylar geliştikçe, şirketimizin galaksiyi tehditlerden arındırmada büyük rol oynadığı ortaya çıktı. Bizi tehdit eden diğer güçlerden hiç haber alamadık. Yani yaptıklarımız, yaptıkların, önemli!
Mücadeleye Hazır
Sıradaki mücadelenin üstesinden gelebileceğini düşünüyoruz. Düşmanlar için gözlerini dört aç ve görevini tamamlarken kimseye acıma. Bu da hallolduğuna göre, geleceğini konuşmaya başlayabiliriz!
Acımak Yok

Eski bir oyunu oynama vakti. Diğer şirketlerin yaptıklarımıza nasıl tepkiler verdiğini görmek istiyoruz. Pek fazla bir şey çıkacağını sanmıyoruz. Ancak. Bizim yalnız silahşorumuzun meydana çıkıp gerçek hasar yaratma vakti geldi!
Eski Oyun

Şimdi, harekete geçmek için doğru zaman gibi görünüyor. Yükselme zamanımız geldi. Bu Uzay Kupası, bulunmaz bir fırsat! Bazı şirketler işin eğlencesinde olsa da, bizce bu profesyonel bir mesele. Profesyonel ol!
Doğru Zaman
Bu şirketin efsanesi olma vaktin geldi. Bu fırsat her pilotun eline geçmez. Şanslı pilotlar arasındasın. Bizim dilimizden anlıyorsun. Git ve savaş!
Efsane ol
Evet pilot, aynen öyle. Git, hasar ver ve tecrübe kazan. Bu sırada medya ekiplerimiz en iyi pilotun başarılarını dört bir yana duyuruyor olacak. Zamana meydan oku!
Zamana Meydan Okumak
Further Recon
An unknown portal has opened up near our home base and initial recon has revealed an unidentified object inside the portal. Further investigation is required.
Population Control
We need to make sure the disposed alien population doesn't get out of hand.
Hard Hitter
According to the message we received from Plutus, the aliens that the beacon releases depend on how much damage the beacon absorbs. We need you to verify his claim.
Ore extraction

R&D believes the disposed aliens are a result of Plutus' experiments, causing molecular deformations that produce Tarnom ore. Get us some for further examination. Make use of the RB-214 I gave you to kill more aliens and harvest the ore. You'll see that it does more damage than usual.
Limited Supply
Seems like the other companies have realised the worth of this Tarnom ore as well. Prove your worth to the company by eliminating some of the competition.
Mass Production
We've discovered various ways this ore can be used - it is a versatile material. Get more so we can use it in mass production to strengthen our pilots.
Infiltration
Our explorers have found one of Plutus' portals in 1-5. Enter and investigate the purpose of this portal.
Infiltration
Our explorers have found one of Plutus' portals in 2-5. Enter and investigate the purpose of this portal.
Infiltration
Our explorers have found one of Plutus' portals in 3-5. Enter and investigate the purpose of this portal.
Watchdog
Keep an eye on the alien drops and make sure Plutus isn't trying anything funny. Get some of that ore while you're at it, will you?
Reducing the Demand
Our ore acquisition rate has been less than satisfactory. Eliminate the other factions' pilots to ensure our supply is not compromised.
Oddity Study
We need more information on these Oddity aliens. I've installed some sensors on your ship to get their readings. Clear out some Oddity aliens so we can extract some data.
Precarious Signals
We've found another beacon on 4-4. This one is giving out some dangerous signals. Be careful!
Opitite breakdown
R&D thinks that these aliens were subjected to a different set of experiments which resulted in a different molecular mutation. Get us some of that ore for analysis.
Initial Readings
Deal some damage to these mutated aliens and get us some readings. Don't get too close!
Correlation
R&D wants to compare the differences between the Oddity and the Awakened. Attack these aliens so we can examine some data.
Alien Bionomics
This beacon is different from the others.. The dropped aliens are not confined in a separate space. Find out what this beacon can potentially do to our ecosystem.
Data Mining
These Awakened aliens are nothing like we've seen before.. Their data is off the charts! We need more data to verify our initial readings.
